lines.text: Why, Michael, you look almost like you were dead!

[to Wentworth after her father's suicide]
I've got to hurry along home now and help Jimmy with his algebra.
I sorta got things twisted. But, I was wonderin', did we have a date to go to the dance tonight?
Why, I thought I...
That's just what I thought too, Stanley; but, it was so long ago, I kinda forgot.
Yeah, one does forget, I suppose.
It was just the funniest thing, but, you see I-I kinda forgot. You 'member I was over at Nellie Anne's a couple a weeks ago? And, I-I met Michael.
Oh, well I see where I take another ride in the rumble seat.
I'll tell you somethin' I never told any other man, ever! Just the way you are, now, you'll be the best lookin' man there. Now, will you come?
No.
Well, you're the first man I ever told that to the just didn't naturally melt away.
I reckon I'm different from the other men - you've never told that to.
Michael, I heard about your fight at the post office this afternoon. It was about me, wasn't it?
Why, no, I...
Why, yes it was. Mae Grandham called me and told me all about it. Hugh Gaston said I was nothin' but a silly little coquette, didn't he? And you thrashed him for it.
We just naturally seem to have a lot to say to one another, don't we? I always did think you were interesting.
Why, you haven't known me, but about two weeks.
I don't suppose he'll ever really trust me again and he's just the most adorable old Daddy.
Why don't you marry me, Norma?
Stanley, you're a dear.
Oh, I know you've heard it so often it's beginning to sound like an echo. But, I do, so, mean it.
You're a fine one, you are. What time'd you get in last night?
Did Daddy ask?
I mean four o'clock, that's all. And make me get the blame for it.
Oh, Jimmy, you are a dear.
Jiminy, you must've been neckin' overtime. Believe me, I'd never marry a girl like that.
Now, now, don't you worry honey child, your old Daddy's just upset a little.
Oh, Julia, he was so mad. You don't suppose he'd hurt Michael?
No, no, honey child, now calm yourself down. Now, you just come and tell your Mammy all about it.
Julia, I love him so much. They don't understand.
Your Mammy understands, just like I always did. Because your still my baby, my little honey baby, my little honey baby.
Did Michael Jeffery make love to you there?
Yes.
Did you resist him?
Yes.
But he forced his attention?
Yes.
And you could not resist his lovemaking?
No.
And he made you yield?
Yes.
He made you yield to an extreme?
Yes.
Hey, Julia! Say, hurry up with that coffee. You know Dad and I can't enjoy our after dinner smoke without a cup of coffee.
Go on, child. I's a-comin'.
Oh, Jiminy. Juliet, you aggravate me. Well, shake a leg, will ya?
Shake my leg? I shake my legs for nobody, no Seh!
